Study Title: Capecitabine and Oxaliplatin Adjuvant Study in Stomach Cancer
Brief Summary:
Primary:

* To demonstrate that capecitabine/oxaliplatin as adjuvant chemotherapy is superior to observation alone in terms of 3 year disease-free survival (DFS) rate in chemotherapy-na√Øve patients who underwent potentially curative resection for gastric cancer.

Secondary:

* To compare the overall survival of surgery and capecitabine/ oxaliplatin as adjuvant therapy versus surgery alone. To evaluate the safety profile of capecitabine/oxaliplatin adjuvant therapy.
Primary Outcome Measures: Recurrence of the original cancer, From the beginning to end of the study|Development of a new gastric cancer, From beginning to end of study|Death due to any cause, From the beginning to the end of study|Adverse events, From beginning to end of study|Clinical laboratory tests, From beginning to end of study
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: NONE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
Locations: Sanofi-Aventis, Beijing, China|Sanofi-Aventis, Seoul, Korea, Republic of|Sanofi-Aventis, Taipei, Taiwan
